meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate.
meanings.sent1: The dancers were synchronizing their movements perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights are synchronizing to allow smooth traffic flow.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers made a mistake and ended up in a funny tangle.
meanings.sent4: Her heart and mind were synchronizing in their decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized fireworks display lit up the night sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: To coordinate in time or cause to occur at the same rate.
meanings.sent1: The musicians were synchronizing their playing to create a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent2: The team members are synchronizing their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clowns entertained the audience with their silly antics.
meanings.sent4: The waves and the wind seemed to be synchronizing in their powerful dance.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized clocks in the train station ensured everyone caught their trains on time.
